page.syntax: Size as N = UI_BITMAP_INFO_GET(B bitmap_data,C format)

argument.name: bitmap_data
argument.description: The name of a blob variable containing bitmap data.

argument.name: format
argument.description: Character Parameter; "w" = width in pixels, "h" = height in pixels, "b" = bits per pixel

page.description: Returns information about a bitmap formats: w=width h=height b=bits-per-pixel.
page.discussion: The UI_BITMAP_INFO_GET() function returns information about a bitmap blob variable. Desktop applications only.

section.example: dim b1 as B ui_bitmap_create_from_screen("test", 0, 0, 4, 1) b1 = ui_bitmap_save("test") ? ui_bitmap_info_get(b1,"w") = "384"

section.description: These examples show how to use the "b" flag to get color depth 'Read the image into a blob and then convert from jpg to bmp

section.example: dim b1 as B dim pic as c pic = "c:\images\8bit.jpg" 'image is an 8 bit grayscale photo b1 = ui_bitmap_save(pic)

section.description: Notice that once the blob is loaded into an in-memory bitmap (using the ui_bitmap_save()) function'it always has a color depth of 24. This is because the ui_bitmap_save() function uses the screen device context'and it translates the image to the display's supported color depth.
